articles.headline: As Israel’s Dependence on U.S. Shrinks, So Does U.S. Leverage
articles.snippet: Israel has quietly sought, and perhaps achieved, a large measure of autonomy from its half-century of reliance on the United States.
articles.abstract: Israel has quietly sought, and perhaps achieved, a large measure of autonomy from its half-century of reliance on the United States.
articles.lead_paragraph: Israel, a small country surrounded by adversaries and locked in conflict with the Palestinians, depends absolutely on American diplomatic and military support. By giving it, the United States safeguards Israel and wields significant leverage over its actions.

articles.headline: Apple’s Fortnite Trial Ends With Pointed Questions and a Toast to Popeyes
articles.snippet: A decision over the antitrust suit filed by Epic Games, and the future of the $100 billion market for iPhone apps, is now in the hands of a federal judge.
articles.abstract: A decision over the antitrust suit filed by Epic Games, and the future of the $100 billion market for iPhone apps, is now in the hands of a federal judge.
articles.lead_paragraph: Tim Cook took the stand for the first time as Apple’s chief executive. The billionaire creator of one of the world’s most popular video games walked a federal judge through a tour of the so-called metaverse. And lawyers in masks debated whether an anthropomorphic banana without pants was appropriate to show in federal court.

articles.headline: Belarus Is Isolated as Other Countries Move to Ban Flights
articles.snippet: The extraordinary forced landing of a commercial flight with a Belarusian dissident aboard escalated into one of the biggest flare-ups in East-West tensions in recent years.
articles.abstract: The extraordinary forced landing of a commercial flight with a Belarusian dissident aboard escalated into one of the biggest flare-ups in East-West tensions in recent years.
articles.lead_paragraph: MOSCOW — The tray tables were being raised as passengers on Ryanair Flight 4978 prepared for the scheduled landing in the Lithuanian capital, Vilnius. Then the plane made an abrupt U-turn.

articles.headline: State Revenues Pour In, Raising Pressure on Biden to Divert Federal Aid
articles.snippet: Unexpected receipts, driven in part by taxes on high earners riding a hot stock market, have prompted Republicans to push the president to spend on infrastructure instead.
articles.abstract: Unexpected receipts, driven in part by taxes on high earners riding a hot stock market, have prompted Republicans to push the president to spend on infrastructure instead.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — From California to Virginia, many states that faced devastating shortfalls in the depths of the pandemic recession now find themselves flush with tax revenues because of a rebounding economy and a soaring stock market. Lawmakers who worried about budget cuts are now proposing lucrative increases in school spending, tax cuts and direct payments to their residents.
articles.byline: By Jim Tankersley and Alan Rappeport

articles.headline: Where Poets Are Being Killed and Jailed After a Military Coup
articles.snippet: More than 30 poets have been imprisoned since the military seized power in Myanmar, a country where politics and poetry are intimately connected.
articles.abstract: More than 30 poets have been imprisoned since the military seized power in Myanmar, a country where politics and poetry are intimately connected.
articles.lead_paragraph: After the first and second poets were killed, the third poet wrote a poem.

articles.headline: Seeking to Restore Palestinian Links, Blinken Risks New Frictions With Israel
articles.snippet: The U.S. secretary of state drew thanks from Israeli officials for supporting their right to self-defense against Hamas. But he risked angering Israel in his diplomatic outreach to Palestinians.
articles.abstract: The U.S. secretary of state drew thanks from Israeli officials for supporting their right to self-defense against Hamas. But he risked angering Israel in his diplomatic outreach to Palestinians.
articles.lead_paragraph: RAMALLAH, West Bank —  America’s top diplomat came to the seat of the Palestinian government on Tuesday with promises of additional aid, a reopened consulate in Jerusalem and a broad sympathetic pledge to rebuild ties that had been severed by the previous administration in favor of Israel.
articles.byline: By Lara Jakes and Isabel Kershner
